node.title: Hong Kong's zero-Covid strategy under pressure as cases soar
node.description: Hong Kong is expected to report a record number of new Covid-19 cases, in the biggest test yet for its zero-Covid strategy amid a growing outbreak

node.title: Trio saved from rip in 'gnarly' conditions
node.description: Three men had a lucky day when an off-duty surf life-saver, who had just decided to spend another 10 minutes at Dunedin's St Kilda Beach, saved them from a "nasty" rip.

node.title: 64% of employees concerned about being in workplace as Omicron spreads - study
node.description: The employee survey also saw a rise in workers supporting a vaccine mandate in the workplace.

node.title: Children's Commissioner plan raises fears of 'diluting' role
node.description: The Detail - Planned legislation would replace the Children's Commissioner role with a board and permanently establish an independent monitor of Oranga Tamariki.

node.title: Convoy protesting at Covid-19 vaccine mandates begins to arrive at Parliament
node.description: Dozens of vehicles from a convoy protesting against Covid-19 vaccine mandates have arrived at Parliament while many more were travelling on the highway in to the the capital.

node.title: Troubled aged care facility Jeta Gardens incorrectly told Rebecca her elderly mother had been vaccinated
node.description: The daughter of a Jeta Gardens aged care resident at the centre of a deadly COVID-19 outbreak says the facility falsely told her her mother had been vaccinated when she had only received one dose the day the state's borders reopened.

node.title: All the coronavirus news you need in the one place
node.description: Get up to speed on all the coronavirus news from across Australia. Follow live.

node.title: Cruise ships seized in the Bahamas over unpaid bills
node.description: Crystal Cruises suspends operations after authorities detained two of its ships over millions in unpaid fuel bills.

node.title: 'We knew this would be coming' - School with Covid-19 cases has 55 pupils isolating
node.description: A Hawke's Bay primary school where four children tested positive for Covid-19 has about 10 percent of its pupils and three teachers away self-isolating. Audio

node.title: Some playcentres enforce mask rules despite no mandate
node.description: Some parents are worried mask rules for play centres are unsafe and they are wearing them even though they do not have to.

node.title: New modelling expects Omicron to peak at 10,000 daily cases
node.description: The latest modelling from Rodney Jones, out later this week, also predicted about 500 deaths over a year.

node.title: Tennis player Peng Shuai again denies claim of sex assault
node.description: Chinese tennis player Peng Shuai has denied ever accusing anyone of sexual assault, adding that she deleted a social media post that appeared to make such a claim.

node.title: NZ study on Covid-19 impacts launched
node.description: People who have had Covid-19 are being asked about the support they received, and ongoing effects, in a survey that will be used to advise health officials.

node.title: Your favourite women's Ashes moments revealed
node.description: With Australia once again winning the women's Ashes, it's time to reveal what you voted for as your top moments in the series' history.

node.title: First batch of the Novavax COVID vaccine touches down in Australia
node.description: The first shipment of Novavax lands in Australia ahead of the rollout later this month.

node.title: DHS warns of copycat attacks after hostage standoff in Texas synagogue
node.description: "The recent attack on a synagogue in Colleyville, Texas highlights the continuing threat of violence based upon racial or religious motivations," the department warned.

node.title: IRS to scrap facial-recognition with ID.me following backlash
node.description: Tax agency backtracks after lawmakers and taxpayers voiced concern that ID system could put personal data at risk.

node.title: Focus on Politics: A border breakthrough
node.description: This week, Deputy Political Editor Craig McCulloch recounts the siege of Fortress New Zealand, and reckons with its reconnection to the world. Audio

node.title: Royal Nod for ‘Queen Camilla’ Caps Years of Image Repair
node.description: Queen Elizabeth II has put to rest decades of speculation by giving Prince Charles’ wife, Camilla, what some see as her “stamp of approval.”

node.title: Services being reviewed in effort to ease pressure on Ashburton Hospital
node.description: Staffing shortages are already putting the pressure on at Ashburton Hospital while the threat of an Omicron outbreak in the region looms large.

node.title: Rivals Nathan Chen and Yuzuru Hanyu will meet again in the men’s short program.
node.description: By Juliet Macur

node.title: The sprint before the Games: A U.S. speedskater sidelined by Covid tests is on his way to Beijing.
node.description: Casey Dawson, who already missed the 5,000-meter race, is hoping to land hours before the 1,500-meter event takes place, if all goes according to plan.

node.title: "Reading Rainbow Live" debut to feature CBS News' Vladimir Duthiers
node.description: Beloved children's show "Reading Rainbow" is returning in March in its new format.

node.title: I.R.S. to End Use of Facial Recognition for Identity Verification
node.description: The tax collection agency will transition away from using a service from the authentication service ID.me amid bipartisan backlash.

node.title: U.S. skier Nina O'Brien injured after crashing during giant slalom event
node.description: After falling during her race, O'Brien just wanted to know "how fast she was skiing," Team USA said.

node.title: Hurdle for Kangaroos' adoption of Indigenous war cry cleared by Players' Association
node.description: Australia's national rugby league side the Kangaroos is set to discuss the adoption of the pre-game war cry made famous by the Indigenous All-Stars.

node.title: Tribunal win for Gisborne kiwifruit growers
node.description: Kiwifruit growers have won their battle against Gisborne District Council over new rate hikes from producing the golden variety of the fruit.

node.title: Health expert reminds people to get tested for Covid-19 as rates fall
node.description: A public health expert is urging New Zealanders to keep up the testing momentum, as testing rates take a dive over the long weekend.

node.title: Wool industry fears mass exodus as Kiwi shearers pack their bags
node.description: Kiwi shearers in Western Australia are already planning to return to New Zealand after the country announced its border reopening plan.

node.title: Vaccinated tourists welcomed back as Australia to reopen international border
node.description: Almost two years after the Australian government closed the country to the world, the international border is set to reopen to those who are fully vaccinated.
